title: Latest updates: Leicestershire Live on Friday 10 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: armed police stand-off ends after 10 hours .
man who died near railway station named .
teacher took drugs with teen student .
tigers name side for anglo-welsh semi-final .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live - updates will start again on monday at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : some sunny spells tomorrow
text: it 'll be cloudy and mainly dry again tonight , clear spells will develop overnight with a risk of isolated fog patches .
a minimum temperature of 8c ( 46f ) .
a generally cloudy saturday morning but possibly some bright or sunny spells .
cloud thickening through the afternoon , with some patchy drizzle .
a maximum temperature of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: auf wiedersehen , pet fans raise money to buy redmile pub
text: last week i told you fans of auf wiedersehen , pet had set up a consortium to discuss concern about the future of the windmill inn in redmile .
the pub that features in the second series of the comedy is up for sale as the owners plan to retire but there 's concern that whoever buys it might try to turn it into housing .
to try and overcome this the fan group has announced they 're going to try and buy it .
they 've teamed up with the local community with an aim to raise £ 500,000 .
the consortium said they 're not doing it for financial gain but to save the pub and create a social hub for the village .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new parks armed stand-off a 'complex siege '
text: leicestershire police chief constable simon cole tweets
in control room @ twitterid complex siege resolved through brilliant teamwork , negotiation and commitment very proud of all involved 1/2
thanks to local community for support and understanding .
one male in custody female witness safe and well @ leicspolice 2/2

documents.title: breakingarmed police end 10 hour operation in new parks
text: the incident involving armed police in the new parks area of leicester has ended .
after 10 hours of police negotiating with a man inside a flat on keightley road they 've told us it finished `` peacefully '' without injury .
the 40-year-old man has been arrested on sus of firearms offences .
a 48-year-old woman who was also inside the flat is unharmed .
the road is to be re-opened shortly and people living inside the cordon area are being told it 's safe for them to leave their homes .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police continue to negotiate in new parks
text: the scene at new parks in leicester - armed police have said a man is refusing to leave a flat .
one other person is inside .
author: Simon Ward
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: cannabis factory found in houghton on the hill
text: police have discovered nearly 2,000 cannabis plants in two houses on uppingham road in houghton on the hill .
no-one has yet been arrested but police said investigations are continuing .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ashby man died from stab wounds
text: a man found dead at a house in ashby yesterday afternoon died from stab wounds .
the woman who was also inside the property on holland crescent had also suffered serious stab wounds and remains in a critical condition in hospital .
no one has been arrested and police are not looking for anyone else in connection with what happened .
police said the dead man is yet to be formally identified .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teacher banned for taking drugs with teen student
text: a science teacher who took legal highs with a student and watched as another one took viagra has been banned from teaching for life .
robert roskelly , 33 , a teacher at winstanley community college , leicester , also admitted staying the night at a pupil 's house .
the national college for teaching and leadership found him guilty of unacceptable professional conduct .
he was banned from teaching indefinitely .
author: Eric Simpson
BBC News Online

documents.title: investigation into cause of death in ashby
text: police have released an update on the investigation in ashby where a man was found dead and a woman seriously injured in a house .
they 've said the woman is still in a critical but stable condition in hospital at walsgrave hospital in coventry .
a post mortem examination on the man 's body was due to be carried out today .

detective chief inspector jonny starbuck said : we still have extensive further inquiries to make , both at the scene , and into the background of the man and woman involved , but at this stage i do not believe anyone else was involved in the incident . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new parks flat stand-off man 'not alone '
text: police have released an update about the ongoing incident in new parks .
they 've said they are continuing to negotiate with a man in a flat on keightley road .
he has refused to leave the property and will not allow officers inside .
it 's thought one other person is in the flat with him , police said .
people living nearby are still being asked to stay indoors until the situation has been resolved .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prince harry coming to leicester
text: a royal is coming to the city in two weeks time
kensington palace said prince harry will visit an hiv charity , a personal development project for inspiring youngsters and pink lizard who use sport to help youngsters from deprived communities .
prince harry will be in leicester on tuesday 21st march visiting three local projects on a day of official engagements .
hrh will visit `` yes you can '' , a personal development project , delivered by @ twitterid which uses peer mentors to inspire youngsters .
hrh will then visit hiv charity @ twitterid - which provides advice and support services for people who are living with or affected by hiv .
@ lassleics is celebrating its 30th birthday .
it works in partnership with agencies to tackle the stigma faced by people living with hiv .
finally , prince harry will visit pink lizard ( @ sported uk ) , a youth organisation using sport to help youngsters from deprived communities .
@ twitterid will he be visiting force headquarters ?
ca n't wait .
will he also visit her royal highness kate mccann ?
good job prince harry , the lord will strengthen you
he should get a real job and stop sponging of the tax payers the people of leicester do n't want him
i wonder if he 'd pop around to my daughters house and wish her happy birthday !
she makes a lovely cuppa !
enjoy your engagement next week prince harry .
sincere wishes .
he gets about a bit does our harry , pop over to derby and see us please x
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : tigers name squad for cup match
text: here 's leicester tigers ' starting side for their anglo-welsh cup match against saracens this weekend .
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: resident 'anxious ' about new parks police incident
text: we 'll return to the incident in new parks now - where bbc radio leicester has been getting some more reaction from locals as to what is happening .
an unnamed woman , who lives on one of the neighbouring streets , said : `` it does make you feel a little bit anxious about what is going on . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breaking man who died after being found near leicester railway station named
text: police have formally identified the man who died after being found injured in the street near leicester railway station in the early hours of wednesday morning .
he was 30-year-old dilovan fazil mohammed ( of no fixed address .
a man , 30 , who has been arrested on sus of mr mohammed 's murder , remains in police custody , leicestershire police said .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police cordon and armed stand-off on leicester street
text: we just need to leave events in new parks momentarily
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police cordon 'was just like watching a tv programme '
text: paul norman , who lives nearby , has just spoken to bbc east midlands today about what he saw earlier this morning .
he said : `` i got a phone call off a friend and i looked round the back and there was a policeman with a gun and a policeman with a dog .
`` there were all these cars parked up on my front - it was just like watching one of them tv programmes . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: neighbours watch siege unfold
text: curious onlookers have got a seat to watch as police continue to negotiate with a person inside a new parks flat
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : armed police in new parks garden
text: this footage was captured by the family living next door to the flat police are dealing with
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: armed stand-off a 'scary ' sight for new parks residents
text: i 've asked people around keightley road what they make to what 's happening - one person told me : `` it does make you wonder - i 'm a bit anxious sometimes to what 's going on .
another said : `` it 's scary when you just live round the corner . ''
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: police release statement about keightley road incident
text: i have just got off the phone to leicestershire police who gave me this statement regarding the cordon on keightley road :
police are currently at an address on keightley road , in new parks , where trained negotiators are in discussion with the occupant of a flat .
in the interests of officer and public safety , nearby residents are being asked to stay indoors . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police cordon at stand-off scene attracts crowd
text: a crowd of people have gathered at the cordon in new parks .
people have been told to stay indoors , while others are not being let back into their homes .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: strict cordon in place in police stand-off
text: i 'm on the corner of keightley road in new parks where in front of me is the flat in question surrounded by armed police officers looking heavily protected .
there 's also police tape blocking off half the road .
people inside their houses have been told they can not leave and must keep their doors shut .
those on the other side of the cordon are not being allowed in .
i spoke to samuel who was trying to get to a friend 's house within the cordon but had been waiting for two hours .
it looks like police could be here for several hours yet .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: people told to 'stay indoors '
text: people in keightley road , new parks , have been told to stay indoors as police trained negotiators are in discussion with the occupant of a flat
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: armed police in new parks
text: we 've received some photos of armed police on keightley road in the new parks area of leicester
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: specialist police negotiators at address in new parks
text: we 're getting reports of keightley road in the new parks area of leicester being cordoned off by police .
one eyewitness said he saw police dogs and armed officers in his garden and that he 's been told to `` stay inside '' his house .
leicestershire police confirmed they have trained negotiators at the road having a discussion with a person inside a flat but refused to confirm if armed officers were on the scene .
more on this as we get it .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather outlook
text: watch : today 's weather outlook
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: a look at wygston 's house restaurant renovation
text: we 've been for a sneak peak inside leicester 's oldest standing home which has now been turned into a pub and restaurant
wygston 's house was built in the 15th century .
in the photo above you can see the new bar - it 's freestanding , which was one of the conditions imposed by the city council who have leased the building out .
it 's expected to open to customers within the next month .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: zoo boss wins women 's award
text: congratulations to dr sharon redrobe .
the chief executive of twycross zoo has been named `` inspirational woman of the year '' at the enterprising women awards .
she was chosen from dozens of nominations for the accolade .
dr redrobe is a primate expert and has more than 70 journal and book publications .
the awards recognise the achievements of women in business .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: rugby : tigers to name anglo-welsh side
text: leicester tigers are expected to name several experienced players for tomorrow 's anglo-welsh cup semi-final at saracens .
the lineups are announced this lunchtime .
assistant coach geordan murphy said : `` the plan is to have tait involved and people like graham kitchener who 've been injured for a few weeks . ''
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: travel : lane closed on st margaret 's way
text: in # leicester - there 's a lane closed countybound on st margaret 's way , and there 's no right turn from sanveygate into town .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: protesters outside public meeting on glenfield heart unit closure
text: nhs bosses held a public meeting at leicester tigers stadium last night on their plans to stop performing children 's heart surgery at glenfield hospital .
there were protesters outside the venue on welford road
thousands of people have signed a petition objecting to the plans but only about 100 tickets were made available for the meeting .
the bbc , and other media outlets , were not welcome inside the public consultation event .
after the meeting we did manage to speak to some people who were inside - one woman said : `` they did n't answer all the questions in the meeting .
they need to address a lot of it and they need to listen to those that are living it , not just look at figures on a piece of paper . ''
another said : `` it was very emotional .
these guys were not answering the questions .
they skirted around them and really did n't put anyone at ease . ''
a 16 week consultation on the proposed closure is now underway and closes in june .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester mercury front page
text: as many as 600 hi-tech jobs will be created at a new £ 75 million space park .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: man 's body found inside ashby house
text: a police investigation is underway in ashby after a man 's body was found inside a house along with a seriously injured woman .
a young child was also inside the home on holland crescent .
officers said she was unharmed and is now with family .
as you can see from this photo , the house has been cordoned off
the woman was taken to hospital in an air ambulance yesterday afternoon and has been described as being `` stable '' .
police said it is not yet clear what caused the death of the man but they are not looking for anyone else in connection with the incident .
they also said the public does not need to worry about their own personal safety .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live news coverage
text: good morning leicestershire - it 's friday !
i 'll be writing the updates on your local live page today with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to comment on any of the day 's stories you can get in touch by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
